And soon she discovers a horrifying fact about her link with the Alien, a realization that may compel Ripley to try destroying not only the horrific creature, but herself as well.

Title: Alien Resurrection
Overview:
Sigouney Weaver and Winona Ryder star in this terrifying, highly-anticipated sci-fi action thriller!

Ellen Ripley (Weaver) died fighting the perfect predator. Two hundred years and eight horrific experiments later, she's back. A group of scientists has cloned her-along with the alien queen inside her-hoping to breed the ultimate weapon. But the resurrected Ripley is full of surprises for her "creators," as are the aliens. And soon, a lot more than "all hell" breaks loose! To combat the creatures, Ripley must team up with a band of smugglers, including a mechanic named Call (Ryder), who holds more than a few surprises of her own.

Alive with spectacular special effects and co-starring Ron Perlman, Dan Hedaya, J.E. Greeman, Brad Dourif and Michael Wincott, Alien Resurrection is a riveting, pulse-pounding roller coaster ride that's "reborn to be wild" (ENTERTAINMENT WEEKLY). Come aboard...if you dare, and witness a whole new breed of terror.

Title: Astronaut's Wife, The
Overview: JOHNNY DEPP ('Sleepy Hollow') and CHARLIZE THERON ('Devil's Advocate') star as courageous NASA astronaut Spencer Armacost and his beautiful, schoolteacher wife Jillian, a seemingly perfect couple whose lives are momentarily shattered when Spencer's mission mysteriously loses contact with Earth for 2 minutes. But neither Spencer nor Jillian know that those 120 seconds of terror will ultimately threaten their sanity, their future and their lives in this heart stopping psychological thriller the critics call "One scary edge-of-the-seat nightmare."

Title: Babysitter's Seduction, The
Overview:
Murder, desire and seduction fuel this passionate tale of betrayal. All Michelle ever wanted was to live a life of luxury - a luxury only Bill and Sallie Bertrand could produce. After the sudden death of Sallie results in Michelle becoming the full-time babysitter for the family, her dream begins to comes true.

However, the dream begins to fade as Michelle's friends, family, even her seduction of Bill, begin to turn against her. What began as an innocent wish, ends in a deadly game of greed and murder.

Title: Bad Boys
Overview: On the mean streets of Chicago, Mick O'Brien (Sean Penn) plays by the rules - the wrong rules. Living a life of crime, his only saving grace is his relationship with his girlfriend (Ally Sheedy). But when a heist ends in tragedy, O'Brien lands in jail with his worst enemy (Esai Morales). Both are bent on vengeance... and the score must be settled in blood.

Title: Bats
Overview:
Something is coming in the night.  The dark air fills with the sound of flapping wings and menacing shrieks.  The night has wings and fear takes flight.

Swarms of genetically altered bats have descended upon a sleepy, small Texan town and no one is safe.  The only hope to stop the growing tide of bloody devastation is a zoologist who studies bats, (Dina Meyer, 'Starship Troopers'), her assistant (Leon, 'Cliffhanger') and the local sheriff (Lou Diamond Phillips, 'The Big Hit').  BATS is a jolting ride of sight, sound and fear.

Title: Beneath the 12-Mile Reef
Overview:
Romance sharpens a rivalry between two families of sponge divers in the Florida Keys. When his father dies during a particularly dangerous undersea expedition, a young Greek-American takes over his father's job as a diver. But the creatures of the ocean aren't the only threat to his life - some humans may be equally deadly. Unique for the spectacular underwater scenes in TECHNICOLOR and CINEMASCOPE.


Academy Award Nominations: BEST CINEMATOGRAPHY.

Title: Best of The Best 2
Overview:
In an illegal "underground" private club in Las Vegas, gladiators fight to the death, for the amusement of rich, high-rollers.

Travis (Chrsitopher Penn), with his two partners, Alex (Eric Roberts) and Tommy (Phillip Rhee), own a martial arts school.  In an attempt to make some big money Travis decides to challenge the undefeated gladiator champion, Brakus (Ralph Moeller).

In the ring, Travis is beaten senseless and at the urging of the bloodthirsty crowd, Brakus breaks his neck.

Alex's young son Walter (Edan Gross) is a witness to the murder of Travis. Out for revenge, Alex, Tommy an dWalter invade the "underground" Coliseum.  In a violent confrontation of marital arts mayhem, they maim and destroy their opposition, unitl they come head to head with Brakus.

In the ring, Tommy and Brakus challenge each other to a fight to the finish. Only one will walk away alive.

Title: Best of The Best 3
Overview:
A Baptist Church Reverend is murdered by a gang in a quiet small town in America's heartland.  Tommy Lee (Phillip Rhee) is visiting his family when he too experiences the hatred and violence that is consuming the town.  At a town barbecue things start to heat up.  the beautiful highschool teacher (Gina Gershon) intercepts a group of skinheads distributing hate literature and is the attacked.  As Tommy's new love interest, he rescues her and they return home to find a burning cross on his family's property, warning Tommy to stop interfering and to get out of town.  

Driven by his own obligation to protect his family at any cost, Tommy decides to find evidence for the Sheriff (Chrisopther McDonald) in order to take action.  In the spectacular final confrontation, Tommy takes on  Donnie (Mark Rolston), the head of the gang, with stunning martial arts techniques.

Title: Beyond The Law
Overview: A man comes from Europe to the States to deliver money to a group of miners, but it is stolen. He asks the sheriff (Lee Van Cleef) for help, unaware that the crooked sheriff was the man who robbed him.

Title: Bloodsport 2: The Next Kumite
Overview:
Alex (Daniel Bernhardt), a talented street fighter and thief, ends up in a tortuous prison camp after stealing an ancient ceremonial sword from wealthy Malaysian businessman Leung (Pat Morita). While there, Alex meets Sun (James Hong), who teaches him humility, self-respect, and the deadliest of all fighting disciplines: THE IRON HAND. Alex also learns the meaning of honor, and promises Sun that upon his release from prison, he will fight in the Kumite.
Realizing he cannot recover the sword alone, Leung arranges for Alex's release from prison, with the agreement that Alex recover the sword for him. Keeping his commitment to Leung, Alex battles his way through the criminal underground, regaining the precious sword and his own lost honor. When Alex agrees to fight in the Kumite, his is unaware he would be fighting for his life against the most vicious monster ever to enter the Kumite arena: Demon (Ong Soo Han). Now, Alex must call upon his friend, Jackson (Don Gibb) and the wisdom learned from Sun in order to win the victory in the ultimate fight: THE KUMITE.

Title: Bloodsport 4: The Dark Kumite
Overview: When martial arts expert-and-cop John Keller (Bloodsport II, III's Daniel Bernhardt) infiltrates death row to uncover the truth behind the execution of several inmates, he joins the ranks of prisoners forced to fight in battles staged for pleasure by a sadistic warden (Derek McGrath). The best fighters are then turned over to Caesar, an eccentric underworld madman. In Caesar's secret playground, Keller discovers that he must compete in the ancient japanese event of Kumite, where fighters from different martial arts backgrounds battle for survival. But instead of fighting for honor, Caesar's Kumite is a spectacle of violence and death aimed at entertaining the most bloodthirsty of audiences.

Title: Blue Streak
Overview:
Master jewel thief Miles Logan (Martin Lawrence, 'Life', 'Bad Boys') has a big problem. A $20 million problem. Recently released from prison for the botched heist of a huge diamond, he's anxious to retrieve the hot rock which he hid at a construction site two years earlier. 

Unfortunately, his hiding place is now at the center of a recently completed high-security police precinct. Posing as a detective, and partnered with straight-laced rookie Carlson (Luke Wilson, 'Home Fries', 'Bottle Rocket'), Miles utilizes his criminal expertise and inadvertently rises up the ranks, winning the respect of his fellow "boys in blue."

Powered by a hot soundtrack with music by Jay-Z, Foxy Brown and Tyrese featuring Heavy D, 'Blue Streak' is a hilarious action-comedy from director Les Mayfield ('Flubber', 'Encino Man').

Title: Blunt, The Fourth Man
Overview:
In an era of treason and instability, the notorious Guy Burgess - Anthony Blunt spy ring is about to be uncovered.  After arranging his friends defection, Agent Blunt (keeper of the Queen's invaluable art collection) finds himself in a desperate scramble to maintain his secret identity.

The otherwise composed group of agents franticall plan their escape.  Evidence must be destroyed and secret meetings canceled.  Time is quickly running out.

Based on a true story set in the 1950's, this film exposes one of the most shocking espionage circles in history.

Title: Boarding School
Overview: The girls at St. Clare's Academy feel that one aspect of their education has been neglected - sex. When the new American student, debbie (Natassja Kinski) comes to stay  she decides to take care of the problem. Together the girls decide to pose as a brothe; to attract the boys from the boarding school across the lake. Calling themselves Club Love Unlimited, the girls soone get a lot of business...until the head mistress finds out.

Title: Boiling Point
Overview:
He's A Cop Whose Reached The Boiling Point

They've got guns and a deadly plan. They're killing cops and hitting the mob. A smooth-talking crime sleaze and his quick-fingered accomplice are not afraid of anyone. But they should be. They've crossed paths with Treasury Agent Jimmy Mercer (Wesley Snipes), a cop at his Boiling Point.

Snipes and Dennis Hopper turn up the heat in this tightly wound police-action manhunt. Mercer is tough, proud, married to his job ... and not above stretching the law to smoke out his partner's killers. Hopper is Red, a scam artist looking for a last big score and running out of options. He'll play those options to the max. He could be playing into Mercer's hands.

Title: Bone Collector, The
Overview:
He takes his victims' lives and leaves behind mysterious pieces of a bizarre puzzle. And the only person who may be able to make sense of the serial killer's deranged plan is Lincoln Rhyme (Denzel Washington), a one-time top homicide investigator. But after a tragic accident changes his life forever, Rhyme can only watch as other cops bungle the case...until he teams up with a young rookie, Amelia Donaghy (Angelina Jolie), who bravely becomes his eyes and ears and searches out the clues that help them solve the case.

But as the killer senses the cops closing in, Rhyme realizes that he and his partner are on the trail of a vicious, sadistic murderer who will stop at nothing on his deadly mission. And at any moment, Rhyme and Amelia could become his next targets - and their first case could become their last.

Title: Born To Win
Overview:
This film is a gritty story of lust, greed, and deceit starring Robert DeNiro, Hector Elizondo, George Segal and Karen Black. Segal plays a small time hustler lurking in the back alleys of the Big Apple, trying to escape the self-spun web of treachery that threatens to enslave him.

An all-star cast, headed by DeNiro, brings to life all the shady figures that surround the desperate Segal and ultimately seal his doom. BORN TO WIN is a harrowing trip into the mind of a disturbed man trapped by his own compulsions. Searing performances by the entire cast makes this a must see film.

My DVD was very grainy - either from a poor transfer or the film itself was shot poorly.

Title: Braveheart
Overview: Mel Gibson stars on both sides of the camera, playing the lead role plus directing and producing this brawling, richly-detailed saga of fierce combat, tender love and the will to risk all that's precious for something mare precious: freedom.  In an emotionally charged performance, Gibson is William Wallace, a bold Scotsman who used the steel of his blade and the fire of his intellect to rally his countrymen to liberation.  Filled with sword-clanging spectacle, 'Braveheart' is a tumultuous tapestry of history come alive, "the most sumptuous and involving historical epic since 'Lawrence of Arabia'" (Rod Lurie, 'Los Angeles Magazine').

Title: Fist of fear, Touch of Death: Bruce Lee
Overview: To find a successor to Bruce Lee, a series of elimination matches are held at Madison Square Garden.  Bruce Lee is featured in some exciting clips.  GREAT SHOP-SOCKY ACTION
SortTitle: Fist of fear, Touch of Death: Bruce Lee

Title: Carrie
Overview:
Based on the phenomenal, best-selling novel of the same name, Carrie is "a terrifyingly lyrical thriller" (The New Yorker) that "catches the mind, shakes it and refuses to let it go" (Time Magazine)!  Starring Sissy Spacek and Piper Laurie (in Oscar-nominated perfromances), John Travolta and Amy Irving, this ultimate revenge fantasy is "absolutely spellbinding" (Roger Ebert), "outrageously witty" (The Los Angels Times) and one of the all-time great horror classics!

At the center of the terror is Carrie (Spacek), a tortured high-school misfit with no confidence, no friends...and no idea about the extent of her 'secret powers' of telekinesis.  But when her psychotic mother and sadistic classmates finally go too far, the once-shy teen becomes an unrestrained vengeance-seeking powerhouse who, with the help of her 'special gift,' causes all hell to break loose in a famed cinmatic frenzy of blood, fire and brimstone that will take you to the very depths of horror - and beyond!

Title: Cell, The
RatingDetails: Bizarre Violence and Sexual Images, Nudity and Language
Overview: JENNIFER LOPEZ (Out Of Sight, Selena) takes a terrifying journey into the mind of a killer in this chilling, critically acclaimed psychological thriller. When a serial killer VINCENT D'ONOFRIO, (The Thirteenth Floor, Men In Black) falls into a coma before his last victim can be found, a child therapist (Lopez) must use an experimental treatment to enter his mind and learn his secrets before it is too late. The visually haunting world threatens her very existence when she becomes trapped by the terror inside. Now, an FBI agent VINCE VAUGHN (Swingers, Jurassic Park: The Lost World) must rescue her from the killer's nightmare mind before he too is lost to the twisted world forever.

Title: Child's Play
Overview: The "chills come thick and fast" (Los Angeles Times) as voodoo and terror meet within an innocent-looking doll inhabited by the soul of a serial killer who isn't ready to die. Form the director of Fright Night comes a "clever, playful" (New York Times) and stylish thriller with "excellent special effects" (Leonard Maltin) and heart-pounding suspense guaranteed to scare! After 6-year-old Andy Barclay's (Alex Vincent) babysitter is violently pushed out of a window to her death, nobody believes him when he says that "Chucky," his new birhtday doll, did it! Until things start going terribly wrong...dead wrong. And when an ensuing rampage of gruesome murders lead a detective (Chris Sarandon) back to the same toy, he discovers that the real terror has just begun...the deranged doll has plans to transfer his evil spirit into a living human being -- young Andy!

Title: Chino
Overview:
Charles Bronson ("Death Wish," "The Dirty Dozen")stars as Chino Valdez, a half-breed, who wants nothing more than to live a peaceful life as a successful horse breeder.  But his serenity is blasted away by a group of racist and scornful men.
	Chino's turmoil is lessened by the love of a beautiful woman and the friendship of a young boy.

Title: Cold Sweat
Overview: Having left his former life as a U.S. Army sergeant behind, Joe Moran has settled into a new existence in France as Joe Martin, with a new wife and her daughter. The past returns to haunt him when former Army buddies come back to collect on a debt. Expecting his help, Joe's friends, now turned enemies, are surprised when he refuses them, but ready to wreak vengeance on Joe's unknowing family.

Title: Terminator 3: Rise of the Machines
Overview:
A decade has passed since John Connor (Nick Stahl) helped prevent Judgment Day and save mankind from mass destruction. Now 25, Connor lives "off the grid" - no home, no credit cards, no cell phone and no job. No record of his existence. No way he can be traced by Skynet - the highly developed network of machines that once tried to kill him and wage war on humanity.

But, out of the shadows of the future steps T-X (Kristanna Loken), Skynet's most sophisticated cyborg killing machine yet. Sent back through time to complete the job left unfinished by her predecessor, the T-100, this machine is as relentless as her human guise is beautiful. Now Connor's only hope for survival is theTerminator (Arnold Schwarzenegger), his mysterious former assassin. Together, they must triumph over the technologically superior T-X and forestall the looming threat of Judgment Day or face the apocalypse and the fall of civilization as we know it.
